metadata.synopsis: Unrepentant Tennessee moonshine runner Luke Doolin (Robert Mitchum) makes dangerous high-speed deliveries for his liquor-producing father, Vernon (Trevor Bardette), but won't let his younger brother Robin (James Mitchum) join the family business. Under pressure from both out-of-town gangster Kogan (Jacques Aubuchon), who wants a piece of the local action, and Treasury agent Barrett (Gene Barry), who wants to destroy the moonshine business, Luke fights for his fast-fading way of life.

reviews: Bruce Springsteen borrowed its title and Burt Reynolds appropriated its anti-'revenooer' appeal, but just shy of its 60th anniversary, 'Thunder Road' remains very much the property of its actor-as-auteur leading man, Robert Mitchum.
The world of moonshine transporters is keyed to Mitchum's fatalist-hobo wryness
Southern drive-in staple Thunder Road is basically The Robert Mitchum Show.
Mitchum as a booze runner is fun enough, but his singing of the title song is the plus.
Mitchum carries the movie on his massive shoulders.
